snippet: The departing education secretary visited a once-failing high school in Boston to highlight the progress that has been made under the administration’s signature school reform program.
abstract: Education Sec Arne Duncan visits Jeremiah E Burke High School in Boston to underscore school's progress under Obama administration's signature Race to the Top school reform program; Duncan acknowledges some of program's shortcomings even as he exhorts schools across nation to persist in maintaining high ambitions despite flagging support for common standards.
lead_paragraph: The departing education secretary visited a once-failing high school in Boston to highlight the progress that has been made under the administration’s signature school reform program.

headline.main: In Swan Song, Arne Duncan Extols School Progress Under His Tenure
headline.print_headline: Departing Education Secretary Extols Improvement in Schools
